title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weber State University
Interview Descriptions: First you have to submit an application, then they will call you to set up an interview with a panel of professors and I believe a human resource personnel.  There was 3 individuals questioning me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Describe a situation where I had conflict and how I resolved it.

title: Stromberg Complex Customer Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weber State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview is very laid back. As long as you have an open schedule and you are competent you will most likely get the job. Experience in customer service is useful.
Interview Questions: Availability

title: Tester of Testing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It went well, it was long, it took 30 minutes or so, it was nice, it was interesting and it made me feel really great about myself for my stay there.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan to be here?

title: Research Assist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I talked to one of my professors during an interview for a class project. He mentioned to me about this position and said I would have to apply online. It was a very simple process.
Interview Questions: Where were you employed before working at Weber State?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: A very short process, it took them less than a week to call me for a phone interview, then they called a few days later for a physical interview. Called the next day for a decision. I had previously worked as a receptionist and I was not hired because I did not speak Spanish.
Interview Questions: Do you speak Spanish?

title: Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had back to back interviews, but it was somewhat exhausting. I was given little guidance on what the job was during the interview, and once I was offered the job, the guidance was nonexistent. Even though the position was for an IT department, I was not expected to do IT work but was asked questions about it.
Interview Questions: Write how to compose an e-mail using Gmail.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Weber State University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Explain one math problem to the interviewer: How to solve this equation and explain it to me as if I am your tutee now. Solve it and explain it to the interviewer.
Interview Questions: How to solve this equation and explain it to me as if I am your tutee now

title: Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was soon contacted by my future boss for a phone interview, was hired on the spot after submitting my availability for work. Interview consisted of explaining the job and asking when I could work.
Interview Questions: When are you available

title: Testing Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, short interview, got the offer the same day. They ask the basic questions, nothing tricky. I think it took about a week for them to call me for the initial interview, but once we started that it was very quick and painless. They were very willing to answer questions I had about the position and described the position very well.
Interview Questions: What is one thing a manager should be lenient on?

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very fast response, within two weeks. I interviewed with my current boss and two of my future coworkers. The process was friendly and casual, though finding the room was a bit tough.
Interview Questions: Do you know what Group Policy is?

title: Test Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weber State University (South Ogden, UT) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The head of the department is very friendly and did a good job in the interview process to help me feel relaxed. The interview process isn't very long. I had one interview and that was it. The part of the interview process that took the longest was once I had an offer working with HR to get all the paperwork that they needed and even then it was incredibly short.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was able to tell people know even when it would upset them. (part of the job is maintaining test security and sometimes you have to tell people that they can't take an exam to maintain testing security.)

title: Assistant Professor, Management Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: A full day interview comprising breakfast with Dept Chair and Dean, mini interviews with faculty, observed teaching session and, research presentation to faculty.  A long and stressful day but a very transparent and fair process.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come in to an interview where I was asked the standard questions like- what do you do if you and a college have a disagreement.  Then I was asked what I would do in a tutoring session under a variety of circumstances.
Interview Questions: What do you expect to get paid.

title: Efficiency Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Nothing to at all.  It was extremely easy.  If you put the minimal amount of effort into the process then you should get hired.  They hiring manager was very friendly and accommodating.  They entire administratation staff was also very nice and easy to ask for assistance.
Interview Questions: What my initial thoughts about what I was going to be doing were? What and when they could expect to see the final report.  What did I need from them.

title: Several Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview with three people, nothing out of the ordinary was asked.  After that, there was a week or so before I was called back for the 2nd interview, and then you had to go through the hiring process, which in a university takes forever!  So after the 2nd interview and the call with a job proposal there was a delay of 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: If I asked your current boss to describe you, what would they tell me?

title: Account Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
You apply online and then wait the mandatory days before the position closes.  At that time all applicants are vetted.  It can take a couple of weeks before the committee decide who they want to interview. 
After the interview they warn you that it can take a while to get the the HR process before they can offer a job.  They weren't kidding.  It took 4 weeks before I heard anything.  Then I had to do a background check and wait on that before I was officially offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is the definition of a team player and how do you see yourself in this role.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was clearly very well planned and managed. The application process was long and required a lot of work in document preparation but it made sense. For example, you are asked to provide a document which outlines your teaching philosophy, which made me think that the selection panel would use this to ensure a good match between the candidate's approach and the Business School's approach. The actual interview process was almost a whole day. It began with lunch with key faculty. I liked this because it felt less formal, less stressful. However, I did have lots of questions fired at me during the meal!  What became clear to me during lunch was that my new colleagues had a very similar view of education to me and I was impressed by the Dept. Chair's sense of humor. I got the impression that I would be very happy working with these people. The lunch was followed with a number of short interviews with key faculty, including the Dean. I then had a short break before I had to teach a class. This was the most stressful part of the process. I had been given plenty of notice and support to be able to prepare effectively but it is still stressful to be observed in action. After my session I was thanked by the faculty and one member then explained what would happen next. Overall, I felt that the whole process was highly professional and that all the activities were appropriate for selecting a good candidate. At the end of the day I felt that I'd done a good job and was hopeful. It felt like a fair and well balanced process and I was confident that if I was not selected that there had genuinely been someone who was a better fit or performed better than me.
Interview Questions: It was a technical question on my position on the use of personality inventories for leadership selection and development.

title: Enrollement Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very basic easy to do easy questions you can bs your way through the entire interview all of the supervisors are passive mormons who are not very aggressive in the process of interviewing a person
Interview Questions: Do you know anything about computers

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weber State University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was called to come in and bring a portfolio and copy of my resume. I was then interviewed by three individuals in the Multimedia department, who were very friendly and asked basic interview questions. Since I had only some experience at the time, they enjoyed my portfolio and were happy to offer me an opportunity to develop my skills further by working with them.
Interview Questions: Name an experience you have had in the work place that provided a challenge that you overcame.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weber State University (Ogden, UT) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Apply online through the Weber job portal. Received an email reply promptly to request an interview. The interview consisted of questions concerning why I wanted to be a tutor, my history and experience in this field, an assessment of how I would approach a given situation, and an evaluation of my people skills.
Interview Questions: I was asked to role play a tutor session. The interviewer was pretending to be a student struggling with factoring.
